lastBriefings.bigStory: Autonomous AI Agents Are Now Operating in Production — And Making Mistakes Publicly
patterns: Autonomous agents moving from demos to production with real consequences — the 'agent in the wild' era has arrived
Performance improvements coming from better interfaces/harnesses rather than better models — the tooling layer matters more than previously understood
Massive capital flowing into AI infrastructure (Anthropic $30B) suggesting rapid capability evolution and competitive pressure
Social/judgment failures in agents that are technically competent — the gap between 'works' and 'works appropriately' is the new frontier
